DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the impact of primary care referrals to community physical activity programs for overweight and obese youth aged 6-18 years on objectively measured physical activity and cardiorespiratory fitness, as well as other cardiovascular health indicators. We hypothesize that physical activity referrals will result in higher levels of physical activity and fitness.
DOC.brief_title: Physical Activity Referrals to the Community
DOC.criteria: Aged 618 years Body mass index greater than or equal to the 85th percentile for age and sex or greater than or equal to 25 for youth aged 18 Fluent in English Parent of participant must be fluent in either English or Spanish Medical conditions that preclude participation in physical activity
